p: On the other hand, the experimental inoculation of cats ( Felis silvestris catus, family Felidae) and domestic pigs ( Sus scrofa domesticus, family Suidae) with a CDV virulent strain for domestic dogs resulted in infection and viral replication in lymphoid tissues and macrophages, but without clinical signs or virus shedding [ 64]. Interestingly, the inoculation of two cats with a strain that was lethal in a captive Chinese leopard (Panthera pardus orientalis, family Felidae) resulted in viremia in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and mild transient leukopenia and lymphopenia, however no clinical signs of disease were observed in the domestic cats [ 59].
